get.summary:
QueryRateTick queries the rate tick for a given transaction type, subject
asset, and payment asset. The rate tick is the exchange rate between the
subject asset and the payment asset.

parameters.name: transaction_type
parameters.description:
transaction_type indicates whether the transaction is a purchase or a
sale.

 - PURCHASE: PURCHASE indicates a purchase transaction.
 - SALE: SALE indicates a sale transaction.

parameters.name: subject_asset.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: subject_asset.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: subject_asset.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: subject_asset.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: subject_asset_max_amount
parameters.description:
subject_asset_max_amount is the maximum amount of the subject asset that
could be involved in the transaction.

parameters.name: payment_asset.asset_id
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: payment_asset.asset_id_str
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

parameters.name: payment_asset.group_key
parameters.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

parameters.name: payment_asset.group_key_str
parameters.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

parameters.name: rate_tick_hint.subjectAssetRate.coefficient
parameters.description:
The coefficient is the fractional value scaled-up as an integer. This
integer is represented as a string as it may be too large to fit in a
uint64.

parameters.name: rate_tick_hint.subjectAssetRate.scale
parameters.description:
The scale is the component that determines how many decimal places
the coefficient should be divided by to obtain the fractional value.

parameters.name: rate_tick_hint.paymentAssetRate.coefficient
parameters.description:
The coefficient is the fractional value scaled-up as an integer. This
integer is represented as a string as it may be too large to fit in a
uint64.

parameters.name: rate_tick_hint.paymentAssetRate.scale
parameters.description:
The scale is the component that determines how many decimal places
the coefficient should be divided by to obtain the fractional value.

parameters.name: rate_tick_hint.expiry_timestamp
parameters.description:
expiry_timestamp is the Unix timestamp in seconds after which the rate
tick is no longer valid.

asset_id.description: The 32-byte asset ID specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

asset_id_str.description: The 32-byte asset ID encoded as a hex string (use this for REST).

group_key.description: The 32-byte asset group key specified as raw bytes (gRPC only).

group_key_str.description:
The 32-byte asset group key encoded as hex string (use this for
REST).

priceoraclerpcAssetSpecifier.description:
AssetSpecifier is a union type for specifying an asset by either its asset ID
or group key.

coefficient.description:
The coefficient is the fractional value scaled-up as an integer. This
integer is represented as a string as it may be too large to fit in a
uint64.

scale.description:
The scale is the component that determines how many decimal places
the coefficient should be divided by to obtain the fractional value.

priceoraclerpcFixedPoint.description:
FixedPoint is a scaled integer representation of a fractional number.

This type consists of two integer fields: a coefficient and a scale.
Using this format enables precise and consistent representation of fractional
numbers while avoiding floating-point data types, which are prone to
precision errors.

The relationship between the fractional representation and its fixed-point
representation is expressed as:
```
V = F_c / (10^F_s)
```
where:

* `V` is the fractional value.

* `F_c` is the coefficient component of the fixed-point representation. It is
   the scaled-up fractional value represented as an integer.

* `F_s` is the scale component. It is an integer specifying how
  many decimal places `F_c` should be divided by to obtain the fractional
  representation.

priceoraclerpcQueryRateTickErrResponse.description: QueryRateTickErrResponse is the error response to a rate tick query.

success.description: success is the successful response to the rate tick query.

error.description: error is the error response to the rate tick query.

priceoraclerpcQueryRateTickResponse.description: QueryRateTickResponse is the response to a rate tick query.

rate_tick.description: rate_tick is the rate tick for the transaction.

priceoraclerpcQueryRateTickSuccessRespon.description: QueryRateTickSuccessResponse is the successful response to a rate tick query.

subjectAssetRate.description:
subjectAssetRate is the number of subject asset units per BTC represented
as a fixed-point number. This field is also commonly referred to as the
subject asset to BTC (conversion) rate.  When the subject asset is BTC
milli-satoshis (msats), this field should be set to 100 billion since
there are 100 billion msats in a BTC.

paymentAssetRate.description:
paymentAssetRate is the number of payment asset units per BTC represented
as a fixed-point number. This field is also commonly referred to as the
payment asset to BTC (conversion) rate. When the payment asset is BTC
milli-satoshis (msats), this field should be set to 100 billion since
there are 100 billion msats in a BTC.

expiry_timestamp.description:
expiry_timestamp is the Unix timestamp in seconds after which the rate
tick is no longer valid.

priceoraclerpcRateTick.description:
RateTick is the internal unit used for asset conversions. A tick is 1/10000th
of a currency unit. It gives us up to 4 decimal places of precision (0.0001
or 0.01% or 1 bps). As an example, if the BTC/USD rate was $61,234.95, then
we multiply that by 10,000 to arrive at the usd_rate_tick:
$61,234.95 * 10000 = 612,349,500. To convert back to our normal rate, we
decide by 10,000 to arrive back at $61,234.95.

NOTE: That if the payment asset is BTC, the rate tick will be given as
milli-satoshi per asset unit.

priceoraclerpcTransactionType.description:
TransactionType is an enum representing the type of transaction.

 - PURCHASE: PURCHASE indicates a purchase transaction.
 - SALE: SALE indicates a sale transaction.
